meanings.def: a thick, solid piece that has been cut or broken off something
examples: He cut the food up into bite-size chunks.
I bought the cheese in one big chunk.
Chunks of masonry lay in the grass around the ruined building.

meanings.def: a fairly large amount of something
examples: I've already written a fair chunk of the article.
This one project has taken a substantial chunk of our budget.

meanings.def: a phrase or group of words that can be learnt as a unit by somebody who is learning a language. Examples of chunks are ‘Can I have the bill, please?’ and ‘Pleased to meet you’.
examples: The listening texts consist of short, bite-sized chunks which are accessible to beginners.
